analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa du ma ma yin te gcig kho na the tshom yin no //

translated: comes the appearance of form.🔽Also, in the Mahayana sutra the Descent into Lanka,

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang theg pa chen po'i mdo sde lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang theg pa chen po'i mdo sde lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: it says:🔽External entities do not exist

original: ji ltar byis pas brtag pa yi //🔽phyi rol dngos po yod min par //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas brtag pa yi // phyi rol dngos po yod min par //
translated: as they are imagined by the childish.

original: bag chags kyis ni sbags pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni sbags pa'i sems //
translated: The mind, polluted by habitual tendencies,

original: don gyi dngos por rab tu skyes //
analyzed: don gyi dngos por rab tu skyes //
translated: arises as an entity of an object.🔽Also, in the Sutra of the Ten Levels,

original: zhes so // mdo sde sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes so // mdo sde sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: it says:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “O children of the conquerors, these three realms are mind only.”

original: de'i phyir na khams gsum pa 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa las gud na skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa tsam yang grub pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na khams gsum pa 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa las gud na skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa tsam yang grub pa med do //
translated: Therefore, none of these three realms exists apart from consciousness, not even to the extent of the tip of a hair split a hundred times.

original: des na khams gsum 'di dag ni rang gi sems nyid sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / ye shes la sogs par rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: des na khams gsum 'di dag ni rang gi sems nyid sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / ye shes la sogs par rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: Thus, these three realms appear in various aspects as earth, water, fire, wind, space, and wisdom, and so forth, in one’s own mind.

original: de yang ye shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du gcig go //
analyzed: de yang ye shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du gcig go //
translated: Moreover, they are one in the intrinsic identity of pristine consciousness.

original: de yang rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las gsal bar gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las gsal bar gsungs te /
translated: That is also clearly stated in all the kings of tantras.

original: de yang rgyud kyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: de yang rgyud kyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: Moreover, it is stated in the King of Tantras:

original: rnam pa kun ni rang gi sems nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ni rang gi sems nyid de //
translated: All aspects are one’s own mind.

original: yul dang bral ba rang gi sems nyid min //
analyzed: yul dang bral ba rang gi sems nyid min //
translated: The absence of an object is not one’s own mind.

original: zhes pa dang / dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
translated: And in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra:

original: lus sems lta bu skyed cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lus sems lta bu skyed cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Generate the body and mind.”

original: de nas thog ma med pa nas spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag gis yul sems tha dad par snang zhing ngo bo tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas thog ma med pa nas spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag gis yul sems tha dad par snang zhing ngo bo tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Then, by the power of the complete maturation of the habitual tendencies of conceptual elaboration from beginningless time, the various concepts of object and subject appear as different objects and minds, but they are not different in nature.

original: de nas rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal sam pu ta las /
analyzed: de nas rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal sam pu ta las /
translated: Then, the glorious Samputa Tantra says:

original: chu bo'i rgyun dang de bzhin rgya mtsho bzhin //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun dang de bzhin rgya mtsho bzhin //
translated: Like the flow of a river and likewise the four oceans,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: chu bo stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis thams cad kyang rgya mtsho las byung nas slar yang rgya mtshor 'jug pa de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa las byung nas slar rnam par shes pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: chu bo stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis thams cad kyang rgya mtsho las byung nas slar yang rgya mtshor 'jug pa de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa las byung nas slar rnam par shes pa la 'jug go //
translated: Just as all seventy-two thousand rivers arise from the ocean and then return to the ocean, likewise, all forms, feelings, and so on arise from consciousness and then return to consciousness.

original: smras pa @189b rnam par shes pa nyid thog ma med pa nas spros pa'i bag chags la zhen pa'i dbang gis gzung 'dzin du snang ba dang / bem po ru snang ba de'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa @189b rnam par shes pa nyid thog ma med pa nas spros pa'i bag chags la zhen pa'i dbang gis gzung 'dzin du snang ba dang / bem po ru snang ba de'i phyir te /
translated: It is said that consciousness itself, by the power of attachment to the habitual tendencies of conceptual elaborations since beginningless time, appears as percepts and perceivers and as matter.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid tha dad du snang bas so //🔽dper na ras dkar po tshon gyis bsgyur ba lta bu'am //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid tha dad du snang bas so // dper na ras dkar po tshon gyis bsgyur ba lta bu'am //
translated: It is because consciousness itself appears as different.🔽For example, it is like a white cloth that is dyed.

original: shel dag pa tshon gyis bsgyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shel dag pa tshon gyis bsgyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: Or it is like a clear crystal that is dyed.

original: de yang yul gyi bye brag gis shes pa de nyid 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa tha dad par snang gi ngo bo la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi bye brag gis shes pa de nyid 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa tha dad par snang gi ngo bo la ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, due to the distinctions of objects, that consciousness itself appears as different, such as attachment and anger, virtue and nonvirtue, and so on, but not in terms of its essence.

original: shes pa dag ni gar mkhan dang / mig 'phrul mkhan dang / sgyu ma mkhan dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shes pa dag ni gar mkhan dang / mig 'phrul mkhan dang / sgyu ma mkhan dang 'dra'o //
translated: Consciousnesses are like dancers, magicians, and illusionists.

original: de nyid rang byung gi ye shes dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyis stong pa spros pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid rang byung gi ye shes dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyis stong pa spros pa'i mtha' dang bral ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: That itself is the great Vajradhara, the self-originated pristine consciousness free from the extremes of conceptual elaborations, empty of percepts and perceivers.

original: de nyid lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes chen po ste /
analyzed: de nyid lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes chen po ste /
translated: That is the great pristine wisdom of spontaneous presence,

original: gang nas kyang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not come from anywhere.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called “nondual pristine wisdom,”

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis stong pa'i phyir dang / stong pa dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir dang bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis stong pa'i phyir dang / stong pa dang / snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir dang bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of the two consciousnesses, object and subject, and because emptiness and compassion are inseparable, and because the two truths are inseparable.

original: de yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
analyzed: de yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
translated: Moreover, in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra it is said:

original: dngos po kun dang rnam bral zhing //
analyzed: dngos po kun dang rnam bral zhing //
translated: Totally free from all things,🔽free from the aggregates, elements, and sense media,

original: phung po khams dang skye mched dang // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched dang // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
translated: free from object and subject,

original: chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid //
translated: the selflessness of phenomena is equality.

original: rang sems gdod nas ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang sems gdod nas ma skyes pa //
translated: One’s own mind is originally unborn,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: the essence of emptiness.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las kyang /🔽sangs rgyas thog ma tha ma med //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las kyang / sangs rgyas thog ma tha ma med //
translated: And in the Litany of the Names of Manjushri it is said:🔽The Buddha is without beginning or end,

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyu med pa //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas rgyu med pa //
translated: the primordial Buddha, without cause.

original: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
analyzed: ye shes mig gcig dri ma med //
translated: The one eye of pristine wisdom is stainless.

original: ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: ye shes lus can de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The Tathāgata is the embodiment of pristine wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'am ye shes ni gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'am ye shes ni gcig kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, consciousness or pristine wisdom is only one.

original: thun mong bca' gzhi'i rim pa ste dang po'o /
analyzed: thun mong bca' gzhi'i rim pa ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first part of the first chapter on the common preliminary.

original: // / da ni lha'i ngo bo gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni lha'i ngo bo gsal bar bya ste /
translated: Now, the nature of the deities will be clarified.

original: de yang gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
analyzed: de yang gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang /
translated: In the Guhyasamāja it is also said:

original: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //
analyzed: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates

original: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu grags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu grags //
translated: are renowned as the five buddhas.

original: rdo rje skye mched nyid dag kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje skye mched nyid dag kyang //
translated: The pure vajra sense bases🔽are the supreme maṇḍala of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / sa chu spyan dang m'a ma k'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / sa chu spyan dang m'a ma k'i //
translated: Earth and water are Locanā and Māmakī,

original: me rlung gos dkar sgrol mar grags //
analyzed: me rlung gos dkar sgrol mar grags //
translated: fire and wind are Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Tārā.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: des na phung po dang khams dang skye mched lha dang lha mor gsal lo //
analyzed: des na phung po dang khams dang skye mched lha dang lha mor gsal lo //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are clarified as the deities and goddesses.

original: rigs drug pa ni dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgya cher 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: rigs drug pa ni dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgya cher 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: The six families are also mentioned in the Vimalaprabhā commentary on the glorious Kālacakra Tantra:

original: phung po drug dang / khams drug dang / dbang po drug dang / yul @190a * //
analyzed: phung po drug dang / khams drug dang / dbang po drug dang / yul @190a * //
translated: the six aggregates,🔽the six elements,🔽the six sense powers,🔽and the six objects.

original: drug dang las kyi dbang po drug ces gsungs so //
analyzed: drug dang las kyi dbang po drug ces gsungs so //
translated: six aggregates, six constituents, six sense-fields, six sense-faculties, six objects, and six action-faculties.

original: de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: In order to clarify that, the form aggregate is Vairochana.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The feeling aggregate is Ratnasambhava.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The perception aggregate is Amitabha.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The formation aggregate is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The consciousness aggregate is Akshobhya.

original: ye shes kyi phung po ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phung po ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The aggregate of pristine awareness is Vajrasattva.

original: sa ni sangs rgyas spyan no //
analyzed: sa ni sangs rgyas spyan no //
translated: The earth element is Buddhalocana.

original: chu ni ma m'a k'i'o //
analyzed: chu ni ma m'a k'i'o //
translated: The water element is Mamaki.

original: me ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: me ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The fire element is Pandaravasini.

original: rlung ni sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: rlung ni sgrol ma'o //
translated: The wind element is Tara.

original: nam mkha' ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: The space element is Vajradhatvihsvari.

original: ye shes kyi khams ni sna tshogs kyi yum mo //🔽mig gnyis ni gti mug rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khams ni sna tshogs kyi yum mo // mig gnyis ni gti mug rdo rje'o //
translated: The element of pristine awareness is Vishvamata.🔽The two eyes are Mohavajra.

original: rna ba zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rna ba zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
translated: The ears are Dveshavajra.

original: sna la ser sna rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sna la ser sna rdo rje'o //
translated: In the nose is Vararati.

original: kha la 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
analyzed: kha la 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
translated: In the mouth is Rativajra.

original: lus la phrag dog rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lus la phrag dog rdo rje'o //
translated: In the body is Irsyavajra.

original: yid la dbang phyug rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yid la dbang phyug rdo rje'o //
translated: In the mind is Isvaravajra.

original: gzugs la gzugs kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gzugs la gzugs kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: In form is Rupavajra.

original: sgra la sgra'i rdo rje'o //🔽dri la dri'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sgra la sgra'i rdo rje'o // dri la dri'i rdo rje'o //
translated: In sound is Shabdavajra.🔽In smell is Gandhavajra.

original: ro la ro'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: ro la ro'i rdo rje'o //
translated: In taste is Rasavajra.

original: reg la reg gi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: reg la reg gi rdo rje'o //
translated: In touch is Sparshavajra.

original: chos la chos kyi rdo rje'o //🔽ngag gi brjod pa dang dbang po la gshin rje mthar byed yab yum mo //
analyzed: chos la chos kyi rdo rje'o // ngag gi brjod pa dang dbang po la gshin rje mthar byed yab yum mo //
translated: In phenomena is Dharmadhatuvajra.🔽In speech and the sense organs is Yamantaka with his consort.

original: lag pa dang len pa la shes rab mthar byed yab yum mo //🔽rkang pa dang 'gro ba la bgegs mthar byed yab yum mo //
analyzed: lag pa dang len pa la shes rab mthar byed yab yum mo // rkang pa dang 'gro ba la bgegs mthar byed yab yum mo //
translated: In the hands and the act of taking is Prajnantaka with his consort.🔽In the feet and the act of going is Vighnantaka with his consort.

original: bshang lam dang dri chen la padma mthar byed yab yum mo //🔽bha ga dang dri chu la gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba yab yum mo //
analyzed: bshang lam dang dri chen la padma mthar byed yab yum mo // bha ga dang dri chu la gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba yab yum mo //
translated: In the anus and feces is Padmantaka with his consort.🔽In the vagina and urine is Ushnishachakravartin with his consort.

original: dam pa'i dbang po khu ba la gnod mdzes yab yum mo //
analyzed: dam pa'i dbang po khu ba la gnod mdzes yab yum mo //
translated: In the semen and the pure essence is Sumbharaja with his consort.

original: des ni lus rnam par dben pa gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni lus rnam par dben pa gsal bar bstan to //
translated: This explains the clarity of the body's emptiness.

original: lha sum cu rtsa drug po de ni 'khor lo drug la gnas te /
analyzed: lha sum cu rtsa drug po de ni 'khor lo drug la gnas te /
translated: These thirty-six deities abide in six cakras.

original: gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo na rtsa 'dab ma bzhi'i dbus na mi bskyod pa'i rigs rnams gnas so //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo na rtsa 'dab ma bzhi'i dbus na mi bskyod pa'i rigs rnams gnas so //
translated: In the uṣṇīṣa cakra, in the center of the four channel-petals, the families of Akṣobhya abide.

original: dpral ba bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo na rtsa 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i dbus na 'od dpag med pa'i sde gnas so //
analyzed: dpral ba bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo na rtsa 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i dbus na 'od dpag med pa'i sde gnas so //
translated: In the forehead, the great-bliss cakra, in the center of the sixteen channel-petals, the families of Amitābha abide.

original: mgrin pa longs spyod kyi 'khor lo na rtsa 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbus na rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs rnams gnas so //
analyzed: mgrin pa longs spyod kyi 'khor lo na rtsa 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbus na rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs rnams gnas so //
translated: In the throat, the enjoyment cakra, in the center of the thirty-two channel-petals, the families of Ratnasaṃbhava abide.

original: snying ga chos kyi 'khor lo rtsa 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus na don yod grub pa'i sde gnas so //
analyzed: snying ga chos kyi 'khor lo rtsa 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus na don yod grub pa'i sde gnas so //
translated: In the heart, the dharma cakra, in the center of the eight channel-petals, the families of Amoghasiddhi abide.

original: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo rtsa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i dbus na rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs rnams gnas so //
analyzed: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo rtsa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i dbus na rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs rnams gnas so //
translated: In the navel, the emanation cakra, in the center of the sixty-four channel-petals, the families of Vairocana abide.

original: gsang ba'i 'khor lo rtsa 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbus na rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs gnas so //
analyzed: gsang ba'i 'khor lo rtsa 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbus na rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs gnas so //
translated: In the secret cakra, in the center of the thirty-two channel-petals, the families of Vajrasattva abide.

original: de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams lha dang lha @190b mo'i dkyil 'khor du gsal bar bstan pas tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas de nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams lha dang lha @190b mo'i dkyil 'khor du gsal bar bstan pas tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas de nyid du gsal lo //
translated: As such, by the explanation of the clarification of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as the maṇḍala of male and female deities, ordinary concepts are removed and clarified in that way.

original: de yang 'khor lo re re la drug tu bstan te /🔽lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo na shar na don yod grub pa gnas /🔽lho na rin chen 'byung ldan gnas /🔽nub na rnam par snang mdzad gnas /🔽byang na snang ba mtha' yas gnas /🔽dbus steng na mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo re re la drug tu bstan te / lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo na shar na don yod grub pa gnas / lho na rin chen 'byung ldan gnas / nub na rnam par snang mdzad gnas / byang na snang ba mtha' yas gnas / dbus steng na mi bskyod pa /
translated: Moreover, each cakra is explained to have six.

original: 'og na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'og na rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: In the emanation cakra at the navel, Amoghasiddhi resides in the east; Ratnasaṃbhava resides in the south; Vairocana resides in the west; Amitābha resides in the north; Akṣobhya resides above in the center; and Vajrasattva resides below.

original: de yang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
analyzed: de yang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
translated: Moreover, it is said in the Saṃpūṭa Tantra:

original: stong pa chen po'i yi ge lnga //
analyzed: stong pa chen po'i yi ge lnga //
translated: The five syllables of great emptiness

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces gsungs so //
translated: and the six syllables of the empty bindu.

original: lus rnam par dben pa'i rim pa ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: lus rnam par dben pa'i rim pa ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second stage of the isolation of the body.

original: // / da ni gsung rnam par dag pa'i srog rtsol brjod de /
analyzed: // / da ni gsung rnam par dag pa'i srog rtsol brjod de /
translated: Now, the prāṇa and āyāma of pure speech will be explained.

original: de yang 'khor lo drug tu gtsug tor du aa /
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo drug tu gtsug tor du aa /
translated: In the six cakras, the uṣṇīṣa is A;

original: dpral bar au /

analyzed: ra sa n'a nas khri bzhi brgya drug cu rtsa phyed dang gsum rgyu //

analyzed: de yang gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las gsal bar gsungs te //

translated: The support and abode of the winds and the teaching of the mantra are taught.

translated: The nature of the body, speech, mind, and gnosis of all tathāgatas is the arising, entering, abiding, and bliss of oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ.

analyzed: de bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bzhi grub pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the four activities such as pacifying are accomplished.

analyzed: de yang sbyor ba yan lag drug la bslab par bya ste /

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yul lnga'o //

translated: The cessation of the five sense organs is withdrawal.

analyzed: de yis rang gnas su bzung nas ni de bzhin du bzung ba'o //

analyzed: de nas bde ba'i gnas la gnas pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //

translated: Now, in order to describe the purity of mind, one should become accustomed to space and so on, and the practice of the six-branched yoga arises.

analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: bsgom pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'di lta ste /

analyzed: gang 'phags pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la ji ltar nan tan du bya /
translated: “How should the noble Subhūti practice this perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: gang rnal 'byor du bya /

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par 'dod pa des nam mkha' la rnal 'byor du bya'o //

translated: Kausika, one who wishes to train in the perfection of wisdom should practice in the open air.

analyzed: sa'i rlung chu la thim pas gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo dpral ba'i yi ge aam las mgrin pa'i 'khor lor thim pas dga' ba dang po skye ste /
translated: The earth wind dissolves into the water, and the wheel at the crown of the head dissolves into the letter AṂ at the forehead, and then into the wheel at the throat.

translated: The coarse duality of external objects and internal mind ceases, and the thirty-three concepts cease. The gnosis of joy arises.

original: de'i rang bzhin du ba lta bu dang sems so sor rtogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ba lta bu dang sems so sor rtogs pa dang po'o //
translated: Its nature is like smoke, and the mind is the first discernment.

analyzed: zla ba'i 'khor lo dang 'bar ba dang lus kyi rnam par rtog pa 'gags nas snang ba sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The moon wheel and the flame and the concepts of the body cease, and the appearance is the nature of the body.

original: de yang shes rab ye shes me chen 'di 'bar bar snang pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab ye shes me chen 'di 'bar bar snang pa'o //
translated: Moreover, this great fire of the gnosis of wisdom appears as a flame.

translated: The great light of Vairochana is the appearance of the moon. Just as the orb of the moon in an autumn sky free of clouds is pervaded by the light of its rays, the moon is the appearance of the natural clarity of all things without exception.

original: pas na snang ba ste zhes gsungs pa dang / de'i sku'i dga' ba dang gsung gi dga' ba dang thugs kyi dga' ba dang ye shes kyi dga' ba tshes gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi pa aa ai ri au ste /
analyzed: pas na snang ba ste zhes gsungs pa dang / de'i sku'i dga' ba dang gsung gi dga' ba dang thugs kyi dga' ba dang ye shes kyi dga' ba tshes gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi pa aa ai ri au ste /
translated: The joy of his body, the joy of his speech, the joy of his mind, and the joy of his gnosis are the first, second, third, and fourth days of the waxing moon, a, i, r, and u.

original: @192a * // yar ngo tshes bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi sad pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gag pa'i sprul pa'i rgyu mthun pa bskyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems so sor rtog pa'i ye shes rgyu mthun pa dag gi rang bzhin dus kyi 'khor lo snang ba'i rang bzhin no //

translated: The moon is the nature of the wisdom of discernment, the bodhichitta that generates the emanation concordant with the cause of the cessation of the conceptual thoughts of the waking state, which has the nature of the first four days of the waxing moon. The moon is the nature of the Kalachakra appearance.

translated: Therefore, in the nature of supreme joy, since water dissolves into fire, the bodhicitta of the wheel of the throat descends to the wheel of the heart.

translated: As long as one is able to hold it, since the medium of external grasping and internal fixation ceases, the mind of discrimination arises as the appearance of the mirage and the sun, and the forty conceptions cease and become nonconceptual.

analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'gro ba'i mar me ni nyi mar snang ba'o //
